intro: Trigonostemon kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tripartite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
